urls.title: Swindon & Wiltshire Club: Collaborative Procurement Symposium – Constructing Excellence SW
urls.description: Dean Spencer, Head of Design & Build The Southern Construction Framework Kingsley Clarke, SCF Operations Lead and Emma Bull, Senior Framework Manager The Environment Agency Steven Williams, Manager Portfolio Assurance This online symposium will provide a unique opportunity to understand how each of these organisations make effective use of collaboration and procurement best practise to deliver projects faster, at lower whole-life cost, with higher quality and reliability. We will be working with LeadersMee

text:
THIS THURSDAY at 10am

The Collaborative Procurement Symposium 

Join us for insight into procurement from some of the region’s most forward thinking organisations: @AskNationwide 
@SCFframeworks @EnvAgency

In collaboration with @WiP_SW  @leadersmeets

https://t.co/lzFDPXUWCu https://t.co/C7dfE0rRWS

urls.title: £100k Get Fishing Fund to benefit new anglers - Angling Trust
urls.description: New Get Fishing Fund will fund more opportunities for new anglers Environment Agency reports over a million rod licences have been sold this year Higher rod licence sales prompts increased investment in the sport The Environment Agency and Angling Trust have today (1st December 2020) announced a new £100k ‘Get Fishing Fund’ to encourage more […]

text:
Still more than a month to get involved with the push to get more people fishing!

Grants of £500 available to encourage new or returning anglers 

More details and how to apply to the #GetFishingFund from @envagency and @anglingtrust: https://t.co/jy8pwqGam0 https://t.co/sQO7nsaZJD

urls.title: River basin planning: Challenges and Choices
urls.description: We want your views on the challenges our waters face and the choices we all need to make to help tackle those challenges. Your responses will help shape the way we manage the water environment.

text: A summary of the Challenges and Choices consultation responses as part of the river basin planning process has now been published by the @EnvAgency  https://t.co/m0IjRkVNGt.

A first but important step to shine spotlight of transparency on journey to equip @WaterUK members @EnvAgency and campaigners with the tools to identify scale of the task ahead https://t.co/TRP2w2haaO

@ConnorPR @EnvAgency @ShropCouncil @FloodForum @FloodArkLimited @FloodArk Our terrace is getting the grant  - I’ve been co-ordinating it. Our situation is quite complex. It involves STW and EA too for a wider solution as well as PFR from our grants. We are flooding through our sewer system - the river doesn’t flood us directly.

@PJGO56 @Bill_Esterson @EnvAgencyNW Hi Peter. The easiest analogy is the one involving a motorway and a A road. Imagine motorway is fully blocked with traffic. Traffic from the A road has no where to go so backs up on the A road. This is exactly what happens when the Alt is high - but with 💦 not 🚗!
